intro: Draba empetroides, commonly known as the alpine mouse-ear cress, is a small flowering plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is native to mountainous regions of Europe and Asia, typically found in alpine meadows and rocky slopes. The plant has a compact growth habit with basal leaves and small, yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. Its leaves are usually covered in a dense layer of fine hairs, which helps protect it from harsh environmental conditions. Draba empetroides is known for its ability to thrive in nutrient-poor soils and cold climates.
